conclusion: Analyze the paths and interactions of the liquids with the baffles.
Liquid from A (Blue) flows down and hits the blue baffle, which redirects it toward the left side.
Liquid from A merges with the yellow liquid from B.
Liquid from B (Yellow) merges with the blue liquid and flows down on the left side.
Liquid from C (Green) merges with the blue liquid from A, flowing left and combining with the yellow liquid.
Liquid from D (Orange) flows down and hits the grey baffle, which redirects it to the right side.
Liquid from D flows into container G.
Combined flow of Blue, Yellow, Green fills container E primarily.
Based on the flow paths and baffles, the combined liquids primarily flow into containers E and G.
E collects the combined flow of A, B, and C.
G collects the flow from D.
